lines.english: 'Gul síos ar an snaois, you're sniffing the coke
lines.irish: 'Gul síos ar an snaois, tá tú ag tabhairt boladh don chóicín

lines.english: Tá tú ag iarraidh cúpla smailc, you're looking a wee smoke
lines.irish: Tá tú ag iarraidh cúpla smailc, tá tú ag iarraidh toitín beag

lines.english: Trí chonsan agus guta, that's Molly or MD
lines.irish: Trí chonsan agus guta, sin Molly nó MDMA

lines.english: "An bhfuil cead agam eochair?", if you fancy a key
lines.irish: "An bhfuil cead agam eochair?" más mian leat bump beag

lines.english: And if you can't grasp that, say Micí Dainín
lines.irish: Agus mura dtuigeann tú sin, abair Micí Dainín

lines.english: Or if he's mad for the coke, then he's a 'snaoisín'
lines.irish: Má tá fonn an chóicín air, is snaoisín é

lines.english: If you don't have a 'dom, then you have no coiscín
lines.irish: Mura bhfuil dom agat, níl coiscín agat

lines.english: Kneecap, gan stop, anois a bhuachaillí
lines.irish: Kneecap, gan stopadh, anois a bhuachaillí

lines.english: You say "Foc me!" when you see na Gardaí
lines.irish: Deir tú 'Foc me!' nuair a fheiceann tú na Gardaí

lines.english: 'Nother one for the cops is "Fuck the RUC!"
lines.irish: Eile le haghaidh na póilíní ná 'Fuck the RUC!'

lines.english: As well as that we have na fir buí
lines.irish: Agus leis sin tá na fir buí againn

lines.english: Just connigh súil amach do na bastardí
lines.irish: Coinnigh súil amach do na bastaird sin

lines.english: So más maith leat an phit, you like a bit of gee
lines.irish: Má thaitníonn an pit leat, is maith leat mná

lines.english: Nó más fearr leat an bod, you like getting the D
lines.irish: Nó más fearr leat an bod, is maith leat an D

lines.english: Más maith leat green dul síos go teach Aoidh
lines.irish: Más maith leat green (cannabas), téigh go teach Aoidh

lines.english: Seo an 3CAG crew le focain ceacht inniu
lines.irish: Seo foireann 3CAG le ceacht fucking inniu

lines.english: Céim a haon to being incognito: Las an dúid agus just foghlaim an lingo
lines.irish: Step one to being incognito: Light up a joint and learn the lingo

lines.english: Céim a dó for avoidin' the law: Caith do focain bally gach aon lá
lines.irish: Step two to avoid the law: Wear your fucking balaclava every day

lines.english: Is céim a trí, seo an ceann is tábhachtaí: Just ná focain éist le RTÉ
lines.irish: And step three, the most important one: Just don’t fucking listen to RTÉ

lines.english: Ná focain éist le RTÉ
lines.irish: Don’t fucking listen to RTÉ

lines.english: Tá na leaids ar fad clocháilte, we're stoned to the bone
lines.irish: All the lads are stoned, clocháilte amach is amach

lines.english: Tá tú ag iarraidh a bheith focáilte, cur snaois i do shrón
lines.irish: You want to get fucked up, shove coke up your nose

lines.english: 'Fear glic' is a housebreaker up in Malone
lines.irish: 'Fear glic' is a burglar living in Malone

lines.english: Ag goideadh airgid ó rich cunts and taking it home
lines.irish: Stealing cash from rich cunts and taking it home

lines.english: 'Gan airgead' is skint, mar a bhíonn de ghnáth
lines.irish: ‘Gan airgead’ means broke, like usual

lines.english: You can't pay for drugs so you get tic gach lá
lines.irish: Can’t pay for drugs so you get tic (credit) every day

lines.english: 'Píonós pointí' is penalty points
lines.irish: 'Píonós pointí' means penalty points

lines.english: The Stinging Roger is the drioblaín at the end of your joints
lines.irish: The Stinging Roger is the butt of your joint

lines.english: An phit is a gee, minge, fanny or a flirt
lines.irish: 'An phit' is slang for vagina

lines.english: If you're fucked from last night, tá tinneas póit ort
lines.irish: If you're wrecked from last night, you’ve got a hangover

lines.english: What you need is a wee bit of faoiseamh béil
lines.irish: What you need is a bit of oral relief

lines.english: But steal her cac and cuir é suas i Shankill Buy and Sell
lines.irish: Steal her crap and put it up on Shankill Buy and Sell

lines.english: Incognito, just follow na rialacha
lines.irish: Incognito, just follow the rules

lines.english: Cur do dope i bhfolach 'is hide your paraphernalia
lines.irish: Hide your dope and your paraphernalia

lines.english: A brathadóir is a Tout, but sure they're always afraid of ya
lines.irish: A brathadóir is a tout/snitch, but they’re always scared of you

lines.english: And if you're fucking grannied then look at the fucking state of ya
lines.irish: And if you're out of it (grannied), look at the state of ya

lines.english: When you see your mate, you say '’Dé an fucking craic?'
lines.irish: When you see your mate, you say 'What's the fucking craic?'

lines.english: Nó 'Cad é mar atá' if you wanna be polite
lines.irish: Or 'Cad é mar atá tú?' if you want to be polite

lines.english: You say 'Maith go leor!' if you think he's alright
lines.irish: Say 'Maith go leor!' if he’s grand

lines.english: Or if he's lán de cac that means he's full of shite
lines.irish: If he's 'lán de cac' that means he's full of shite

lines.english: A dúid mór ramhar is a busty joint
lines.irish: A big fat joint is 'dúid mór ramhar'

lines.english: And you always speak the lingo at a Garda checkpoint
lines.irish: And always use the lingo when stopped by the Gardaí

lines.english: Ach rud amhain eile sula ndéanaimid dearmad:
lines.irish: But one more thing before we forget:

lines.english: You say 'Na Sé Chontae' for the North of Ireland
lines.irish: Say 'Na Sé Chontae' instead of Northern Ireland

lines.english:
Céim a haon to being incognito:
Las an dúid agus just foghlaim an lingo
lines.irish:
Step one to being incognito:
Light a joint and learn the slang

lines.english:
Céim a dó for avoidin' the law:
Caith do focain bally gach aon lá
lines.irish:
Step two to avoid the law:
Wear your fucking balaclava every day

lines.english:
Is céim a trí, seo an ceann is tábhachtaí
Just ná focain éist le RTÉ
lines.irish:
And step three, most important:
Just don’t fucking listen to RTÉ

lines.english:
Right!
An bhfuil sibh ag focain éisteacht?
lines.irish:
Right!
Are ye fucking listening?
